intro: Cleome arenaria, commonly known as sand cleome, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the Americas. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender, branching stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in loose inflorescences, often appearing in late summer. Its flowers are characterized by five petals and numerous stamens, which give them a delicate, feathery appearance. Cleome arenaria is adapted to thrive in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in disturbed or dry habitats.
